body:

```

Neovim v0.2.3-874-g739fb93a9
Apparently it happens via https://github.com/Shougo/neco-vim (I've been using an older commit there (Shougo/neco-vim@d28e1ea).

/cc @shougo since he might be aware of it and/or has fixed it already?!

comment_data.body:

```

I am not sure if I really edited a .vim file when this happened, but at it's probable.

From what I can tell this does not provide much more information than the bt from gdb, and with the ASAN build there's actually no entry with `coredumpctl`, i.e. the SEGV is not "propagated"?!

Tried this with ASAN, no luck:

    :let a=map(filter(split(execute('set all'), '\s\{2,}\|\n'), "!empty(v:val) && v:val =~ '^\\h\\w*=\\?'"), "substitute(v:val, '^no\\|=\\zs.*$', '', '')")

maybe it's related to handling a RPC event in insert-mode (with the completion popup activated?).

@justinmk 
Do you think the ASAN backtrace is for the crash?

Please reopen it. It still happens every time in the last version . I have an exact reproduction in the referenced issue. If 
you want a more detailed instructions, say so.

"exact reproduction" looks like "use coc.nvim for a bit". Are there more specific instructions I'm missing?

@eyalk5 btw are you trying the latest nightly/HEAD version? There have been some fixes in the last week.

Well, every time I type "set s" in any .vim file, it crashes. So it seems easy to reproduce. 
But it does so unless I disable a plugin. It doesn't matter which. Any plugin I have disabled caused it to be OK. So, I couldn't come up with a minimal configuration so far. So, you are right basically. 
What is special about s, is that when it doesn't crash Neco has a very long list of completion for words starting with s. 

 I haven't tried the last version, frankly, I think that the chances it will fix it are slim. 
I wouldn't close a bug that I can't reproduce, but that is just me.

> But it does so unless I disable a plugin. It doesn't matter which. Any plugin I have disabled caused it to be OK.

But you still have some other disabled then?

Please try the nightly - it should be easy to build / install after all.
@blueyed @eyalk5 are you still experiencing this crash?
Options system has had major changes since then.
